forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 5pm. Mostly sunny, with a high near 53. West wind 10 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 11pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 44. South southwest wind 7 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the afternoon unfolds in Downtown San Francisco, a delicate dance of clouds plays across the sky, filtering the sunlight into a muted glow. Presently, the air feels brisk, the temperature hovering unseasonably cool, with anticipatory hints of rain that swirl in from the west. With the forecast hinting at a chance of showers before evening, one might glimpse the Golden Gate Bridge shrouded softly by low-hanging clouds, suggesting the presence of that familiar marine layer creeping in, a reminder of the city’s ever-changing weather. 

By nightfall, the rain is sure to embrace the city more fervently, transforming the streets into a shimmering tableau. Residents would do well to dress warmly, perhaps donning a sturdy jacket beneath which a soft sweater can ward off the chill, complemented by an umbrella, just in case the evening’s forecast holds true. With a forecast of steady showers ahead, the time could be best spent enjoying a quiet moment in a local café with warm coffee or tea, perhaps gazing out at the veils of rain that create a serene backdrop, or taking a leisurely stroll under the canopy of clouds, appreciating the vibrant greens of the parks as they awaken in the gentle embrace of rain.
